alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 14 at 3:36PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Middle Tennessee, including the following county, Jackson. * WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 334 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms across eastern Jackson County. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in the past hour. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dodson Branch, Gainesboro and Whitleyville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are numerous low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
